IsParametrized¶

class decodes.core.dc_curve.IsParametrized¶

Bases: decodes.core.dc_base.Geometry

Abstract class for describing functionality common to Curves and Surfaces

__init__()¶

x.__init__(...) initializes x; see help(type(x)) for signature

far(pt, tolerance=None, max_recursion=20, resolution=8)¶
Finds a location on this curve which is furthest from the given Point.
Unstable and inaccurate.
Recursive function that searches for further points (at a given division resolution) until the search area shrinks to given tolerance (Curve.tol/10 by default) in domain space.
Returns a tuple containing a Point, a t-value associated with this Point, and the distance from this Point to the given Point.
Parameters:
  • pt (Point) – Point to look for the farthest point on a curve.
  • tolerance (float) – Tolerance to search for the far point. Defaults to None.
  • max_recursion (int) – Maximum number of loops to look for the farthest point. Defaults to 20.
Result :

Tuple containing a Point, a t-value associated with this point, and the distance from this Point to the given Point.
Return type:

(Point, float, float)

 
def func(u):
    return Point(math.sin(u),u)
Inv=Interval(0,20)
crv = Curve(func,Inv)   

f_tup=crv.far(Point(0,0,0))
far_pt(pt, tolerance=None, max_recursion=20, resolution=8)¶
Finds a location on this curve which is furthest from the given Point.
Unstable and inaccurate.
Recursive function that searches for further points u (at a given division resolution) ntil the search area shrinks to given tolerance (Curve.tol/10 by default) in domain space.
Returns a Point.
Parameters:
  • pt (Point) – Point to look for the furthest point on a curve.
  • tolerance (float) – Tolerance to search for the far point. Defaults to None.
  • max_recursion (int) – Maximum number of loops to look for the nearest point. Defaults to 20.
Result :

Point.
Return type:

Point
func¶
near(pt, tolerance=None, max_recursion=20, resolution=8)¶
Finds a location on this curve which is nearest to the given Point.
Unstable and inaccurate.
Recursive function that searches for closer points (at a given division resolution) until the search area shrinks to given tolerance (Curve.tol/10 by default) in domain space.
Returns a tuple containing a Point, a t-value associated with this point, and the distance from this Point to the given Point.
Parameters:
  • pt (Point) – Point to look for the nearest point on a curve.
  • tolerance (float) – Tolerance to search for the near point. Defaults to None.
  • max_recursion (int) – Maximum number of loops to look for the nearest point. Defaults to 20.
Result :

Tuple containing a Point, a t-value associated with this point, and the distance from this Point to the given Point.
Return type:

(Point, float, float)

 
def func(u):
    return Point(math.sin(u),u)
Inv=Interval(0,20)
crv = Curve(func,Inv)

n_tup=crv.near(Point(0,0,0))
near_pt(pt, tolerance=None, max_recursion=20, resolution=8)¶
Finds a location on this curve which is nearest to the given Point.
Unstable and inaccurate.
Recursive function that searches for closer points (at a given division resolution) until the search area shrinks to given tolerance (Curve.tol/10 by default) in domain space.
Returns a Point.
Parameters:
  • pt (Point) – Point to look for the nearest point on a curve.
  • tolerance (float) – Tolerance to search for the near point. Defaults to None.
  • max_recursion (int) – Maximum number of loops to look for the nearest point. Defaults to 20.
Result :

Point.
Return type:

Point
